snippet: The corner of 138th Street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard was ceremonially renamed after Justice Bruce McM. Wright, nicknamed “Turn ’Em Loose Bruce” by the city police union in the 1970s.
abstract: Corner of 138th Street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr Boulevard in Harlem is ceremonially renamed after Justice Bruce McM Wright, whose quarter-century on the bench was marked by turbulence and criticism over some of his bail decisions in the 1970s; Wright, who died in 2005, believed that white judges often treated black defendants unfairly and gave some of them little or no bail.
lead_paragraph: The corner of 138th Street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard was ceremonially renamed after Justice Bruce McM. Wright, nicknamed “Turn ’Em Loose Bruce” by the city police union in the 1970s.
